results.title: Cell 1
results.brief_description: This video aims to give insight into the structure of cells, showing mutual as well as divergent characteristics of bacterial (procaryotic) and human (eukaryotic) cells. The structure and function of DNA, RNA and proteins are explained. Basic cellular proceses, the structure of the macromolecules, and the three-dimensional conformations are shown in computer generated models. Sutiable for Secondary level students.

results.title: Celebrations
results.brief_description: Features two films recounting the history and development of the SEC. “Fifty Years of Service” focuses on the history of electricity in Victoria from the late 1800’s to the development of the SEC in 1919. Highlights the achievements of Sir John Monash, the first General Manager and Chairman of the SEC. Looks at the development of power plants at Yallourn, Morwell, Hazelwood and Kiewa. Examples of the impact of electricity on domestic life at the time is shown with new appliances such as hair dryers and vacuum cleaners entering the home. (33 min) “Generations of Power” is another historical retrospective this time with comments from several SEC staff members from between the 1940’s to 1990’s. Includes a decade by decade look at the impact of electricity on Victorian Society. (23 min)

results.title: Cecily (K)
results.brief_description: An animated film about a little girl who, discovering she can fly by flapping her ears, takes off for Africa. She makes friends with the elephants, who have ears as big as hers, and forms an elephant orchestra which becomes world famous. Based on the story by Milos Macourek.

results.title: Cavity walls
results.creator_credit: Brent Productions and Topical Film Company
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Brickwork”.
One of a series of eight films which gives a complete basic training in building construction with reference to brickwork. The purpose of cavity construction is explained and the methods employed are demonstrated. Treatment at the foot, damp-proof course, ties, prevention of fill-in of cavity by mortar droppings, installation of ventilation, cross walls, sealing off of window and door openings at sills and heads, fixing of joists and sealing of top of wall at the all plate.

results.title: Cave man
results.brief_description: Animated cartoon featuring Willie Whopper. While paying a visit to the Natural History Museum, Willie relates a tall tale about how he saved his girlfriend Mary from a dinosaur.

results.title: Cavalcade of Australia
results.brief_description: On the celebration of Australia’s Jubilee as a Commonwealth, Australian film production organisations, both government and commercial, made available for this film archival material from their libraries. The film shows highlights of the important events of the first 50 years of the Federation. Music by Sydney John Kay.

results.title: Cattle trail
results.brief_description: Cattle on the Cascade Station in South Westland are rounded up twice yearly and taken on an arduous three weeks drive up the coast to the sale-yards at Wataroa. This film provides a record of the journey which traverses some of New Zealand’s finest forest, mountain, lake, river, and alpine scenery.

results.title: Cattle king
results.creator_credit: Bill Bennett and Bill Bennett Productions
results.brief_description: The story of Sir Sydney Kidman and his battle with the Australian land. Kidman began as a roustabout and eventually came to control over a hundred properties and owned more cattle than any other person in the world. He attempted to avoid the full effects of Australia’s periodical droughts by buying up territories covering a wide area of Northern Australia. His policy was put to the test in 1901-1902 and 1926-30; his battle with the droughts of these years is dramatically portrayed.
